instructions: ["▢ 500 grams (1.1 lbs.) chicken (bone-in or boneless)", "▢ ¾ to 1 cup (1 large) onions (thinly sliced)", "▢ 3 tablespoons oil (divided 1+ 2)", "▢ ¾ cup (2 medium) tomatoes (deseeded & chopped finely )", "▢ ¼ teaspoon turmeric", "▢ ¾ tablespoon ginger (peeled & chopped, read notes for substitute)", "▢ ¾ tablespoon garlic (peeled & chopped, read notes for substitute)", "▢ ½ teaspoon salt (adjust to taste)", "▢ ¼ cup coriander leaves (fine chopped)", "▢ ¼ teaspoon nutmeg powder or small piece (jaiphal)", "▢ 4 cloves (laung)", "▢ 1 strand mace (javitri)", "▢ 1½ tablespoons white poppy seeds (khus khus)  (read notes for substitutes)", "▢ 1 tablespoon white sesame seeds (til)", "▢ 4 to 5 black pepper corn", "▢ 4 to 5 dried red chilies (lavangi chillies/ Kashmiri/ Byadgi)", "▢ ¼ cup dried coconut (preferably copra or desiccated coconut)", "▢ 2 tablespoons coriander seeds (daniya)", "▢ 1 inch cinnamon piece (dalchini)", "▢ 3 green cardamom (elaichi)", "▢ 1 black cardamom (badi elaichi)", "▢ 1 teaspoon cumin seeds", "▢ Heat a pan on a low flame. Add red chilies, coriander seeds, cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms, pepper, mace and nutmeg. Roast until golden without burning. If using nutmeg powder, add it in the next step.", "▢ Add coconut, cumin, sesame seeds and poppy seeds. Saute until all the ingredients turn to golden. Do not over roast as the spices will taste bitter.", "▢ Set these aside and cool. Blend spices to a fine powder.", "▢ Meanwhile add 1 tablespoon oil to a deep pan or pot & heat it.  Add onions & fry/saute them until golden.", "▢ Add chopped ginger garlic and saute without burning until the raw smell goes off. Set these aside to cool.", "▢ Transfer onion and ginger garlic to the spice powder and blend again to a fine powder. name: Paneer Tikka Masala Recipe
instructions: ["½ cup greek yogurt (hung curd, refer notes)", "1 teaspoon ginger garlic paste (or ¾ teaspoon each grated ginger and garlic)", "¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder", "½ teaspoon garam masala", "1/8 teaspoon turmeric", "¼ teaspoon kasuri methi", "1 teaspoon oil", "¼ teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon lemon juice (optional)", "1/8 teaspoon turmeric", "¾ to 1 teaspoon garam masala", "¾ to 1 teaspoon red chilli powder", "Place a steel bowl in your curry so it is not immersed in the curry.", "Burn a small piece of natural wood charcoal over direct fire holding it with a tong until red hot. name: Masala Dosa
instructions: ["Soak rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 6-8 hours or overnight.", "Grind the soaked ingredients into a smooth batter and ferment it overnight.", "Boil, peel, and mash the potatoes.", "Chop onions, green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves finely.", "Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.", "Add chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, and curry leaves; sauté until onions are translucent.", "Add turmeric powder and mashed potatoes; mix well and cook for a few minutes to make the potato filling.", "Heat a non-stick pan or tawa, pour a ladle of dosa batter and spread it thinly in a circular motion.", "Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden and crispy.", "Place a portion of the potato filling on one side of the dosa and fold it over.", "Serve hot with chutney and sambar."]

name: Idli Sambar
instructions: ["Boil the ground garlic in some water until cooked.", "Chop the onion, tomato, carrots, and boil the potatoes separately and chop them.", "Prepare tamarind water by soaking tamarind in hot water and straining.", "Heat mustard oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and red chillies.", "Add a pinch of asafoetida and curry leaves, then sauté chopped onions until translucent.", "Add chopped tomatoes, carrots, and boiled potatoes, sauté briefly.", "Add salt, boiled tamarind water, and enough water to maintain consistency.", "Add red chili powder, sambar masala, and jaggery; mix well.", "Let the sambar simmer for 15-20 minutes with the lid on until flavors meld."]

name: Filter Coffee Recipe (South Indian Coffee)
instructions: ["Take the coffee filter. Fit the top vessel on the lower one. name: Cold Coffee Recipe (Iced Coffee)
instructions: ["In a blender take your instant coffee, raw sugar, add warm water.", "Blend for a minute or until the coffee solution becomes frothy and the brown color lightens a bit.", "Add 6 to 7 ice cubes. For a thick cold coffee, you can reduce the ice cubes from 2 to 4.", "Pour 2 cups cold milk.", "Whole milk gives a slightly thicker consistency and is richer. name: Poha
instructions: ["Rinse the flattened rice (poha) in a colander under running water and drain well.", "Chop the onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves.", "Juice the lemon.", "Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.", "Add chopped onions and green chilies; sauté until onions turn translucent.", "Add turmeric powder and salt; mix well.", "Add the drained poha to the pan and gently mix to combine with the spices.", "Cook for 2-3 minutes until poha is heated through.", "Turn off the heat and add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves; mix gently."]

name: Perfect Upma
instructions: ["Finely chop onions, capsicum, green chilies, ginger, and coriander leaves.", "Measure and keep all dals, spices, semolina, and nuts ready.", "Heat ghee in a pan and fry moong dal and cashew nuts until golden; remove and set aside.", "Roast semolina in ghee until aromatic and lightly golden; remove and set aside.", "In the same pan, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, asafoetida, and curry leaves; sauté until dals turn golden.", "Add chopped onions, capsicum, and green chilies; sauté until onions turn translucent.", "Add ginger, green peas, black pepper powder, salt, and sugar; mix well and cook for a minute.", "Add 3 cups of water and bring it to a boil.", "Slowly add roasted semolina little by little, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.", "Cover and cook on low heat for 2 minutes until water is absorbed and upma is cooked.", "Add 2 tsp ghee, lemon juice, chopped coriander, and fried cashew nuts; mix gently and serve hot."]

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: ["Boil and mash the potatoes until smooth.", "Mix mashed potatoes with salt and spices as desired.", "Knead the wheat flour with water to make a soft dough and let it rest.", "Divide the dough and potato mixture into equal portions.", "Make round balls from the dough and the potato filling.", "Roll out a dough ball slightly, place the potato filling in the center, and seal it properly.", "Gently roll out the stuffed dough ball into a flat circle, taking care not to let the filling spill out.", "Heat a tawa or skillet and cook the paratha on medium heat until golden brown spots appear on both sides.", "Apply ghee on both sides while cooking for a rich flavor and crisp texture.", "Remove from heat and serve hot with curd, butter, and soya or pickles."]

name: Chilli Paneer Paratha
instructions: ["Grate the paneer and finely chop the mixed vegetables and green chillies.", "Mix grated paneer, chopped vegetables, green chilli, ginger-garlic paste, red chilli powder, garam masala, and salt to prepare the stuffing.", "In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour with some grated vegetables to knead a soft dough using water.", "Divide the dough into equal portions and roll out a small circle.", "Place a portion of the chilli paneer stuffing in the center of the rolled dough.", "Fold the dough over the stuffing and seal the edges, then gently roll out into a paratha.", "Cook the paratha on a hot pan without adding ghee or oil initially, flipping until both sides are cooked and slightly crispy.", "Serve hot with a dollop of ghee or butter on top."]

name: Chicken Chettinad Gravy Recipe
instructions: ["1½ tablespoon coriander seeds", "1 teaspoon fennel seeds", "1 teaspoon cumin seeds", "½ teaspoon black pepper corn", "5 green cardamoms", "1 inch cinnamon piece", "4 cloves", "1 small star anise", "1 small piece stone flower (kalpasi/ dagad phool, if you use more, your dish can taste bitter)", "4 to 5 dried red chilies (may substitute – 1 tsp red chili powder, use later while grinding or when you add tomatoes)", "Bone-in chicken is favored for the extra flavor the bones produce. Traditionally, whole chicken that’s cut-up to smaller portions (curry-cut) is used. But if you don’t prefer that, you may use boneless chicken breast or thighs that are cut up to 1½ inch portions. Cut down the cook time else they can dry out & overcook.", "You can make the dry spice blend without coconut to store for 3 months in the refrigerator or for 1 month at room temperature.", "You can make the Chettinad masala paste ahead and refrigerate for a week. Beyond the mentioned time, the spice blend begins to lose the flavors.", "Traditionally chicken is not marinated, but I prefer to do that as it removes the poultry smell. Yogurt or lemon juice helps do that and the spices in the marinade season the chicken well at this stage.", "Chettinad curry is not a tomato based curry, so you may cut down the amount of tomatoes if you want.", "It is essential to grind the spices super smooth else you will find the gravy gritty. Chicken cooks faster than mutton, so the gravy won’t get a lot of time to cook down & soften the grits.", "▢ ½ kg (1.1 lbs.) chicken (bone-in is best)", "▢ ⅛ teaspoon turmeric", "▢ ¼ teaspoon red chili powder", "▢ 1 tablespoon lemon juice or yogurt", "▢ 1 tablespoon ginger garlic paste (or 4 garlic cloves + 1  inch ginger)", "▢ ½ teaspoon sea salt", "▢ 2 to 3 tablespoons oil (gingelly oil if preferred, divided)", "▢ 1 bay leaf (optional)", "▢ 1 cup (1 large) onions (finely chopped or sliced shallots)", "▢ 1½ cups (2 medium) tomatoes (finely chopped or pureed)", "▢ 2 sprigs curry leaves (divided)", "▢ ½ to 1 cup hot water (start with lower amount)", "▢ 4 to 5 (4 grams) dried red chilies (refer notes , substitute – 1 tsp red chili powder)", "▢ 1½ tablespoon (9 grams) coriander seeds", "▢ 1 teaspoon (3 grams) fennel seeds", "▢ 1 teaspoon (3 grams) cumin seeds", "▢ ½ teaspoon (1 gram) pepper corn", "▢ 5 (1 gram) green cardamoms (elaichi)", "▢ 1 inch (1.5 grams) cinnamon stick", "▢ 4 cloves", "▢ 1 small star anise", "▢ 1 small piece stone flower (kalpasi/ dagad phool)", "▢ ¼ cup (35 grams) coconut (grated, fresh or frozen, or unsweetened shredded)", "▢ 8 cashews (or 1 tbsp roasted chana dal or white poppy seeds)", "▢ Marinate chicken with chili powder, turmeric, salt, ginger garlic and lemon juice or yogurt. Cover and rest aside until needed.", "▢ To a pan, add red chilies, cinnamon, cloves, star anise, dagad phool, black pepper corn, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, coriander seeds and cardamoms.", "▢ Heat on a medium flame for 2 mins. Turn off.", "▢ Transfer all the roasted spices and make a fine powder. Your chettinad masala is ready. To make the paste, add coconut, curry leaves and cashews if using to the same grinder jar. name: Vegetable Sandwich
instructions: ["Chop capsicum, carrots, cucumber, and tomato into small pieces.", "Mix the chopped vegetables with black pepper powder, salt, and mayonnaise until well combined.", "Apply butter on both sides of the bread slices.", "Spread the vegetable mixture evenly on one buttered bread slice.", "Place the other buttered bread slice on top to form a sandwich.", "Cut the sandwich into desired shapes and serve."]

name: Indian Egg Bhurji
instructions: ["Finely chop the red onion, green chili, tomatoes, and fresh cilantro.", "Crack the eggs into a bowl, add a pinch of salt, and whisk well.", "Heat ghee in a pan until melted and aromatic.", "Add the chopped red onion and cook on medium heat until caramelized and softened.", "Toast cumin seeds in the pan until fragrant.", "Add chopped green chili and toast briefly on medium heat.", "Add ginger garlic paste and sauté for a minute.", "Add garam masala, turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, and salt; toast the spices briefly.", "Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and start to melt.", "Pour in the whisked eggs and gently mix into the onion-tomato mixture.", "Cook on low heat, stirring gently, until eggs are soft and cooked through.", "Finish by sprinkling fresh cilantro on top and optionally some cheese."]

name: Plain Omelette
instructions: ["Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them until smooth.", "Season the eggs with salt and pepper.", "Heat a pan over medium-high heat and add butter.", "Pour the beaten eggs into the hot pan.", "Allow the edges to brown slightly, then fold the edges inward to cook evenly.", "Add cheese on top before folding the omelette fully.", "Cook just enough so the interior remains soft but the edges develop a light crust.", "Serve immediately, optionally with hot sauce."]

name: Masala Omelette
instructions: ["Chop onions, red, yellow, and green bell peppers, tomatoes, green chili, and coriander leaves.", "Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.", "Add the beaten eggs mixed with chopped vegetables and spices into the pan.", "Cook the eggs until set and then flip to cook the other side until golden brown.", "Remove from heat and serve hot."]

name: Rava Kesari
instructions: ["Measure all ingredients and keep them ready.", "Soak saffron strands in a tablespoon of warm water if using saffron.", "Chop or prepare nuts if needed.", "Heat ghee in a pan on medium flame.", "Add cashew nuts and raisins and fry until golden, then remove and set aside.", "Add semolina to the hot ghee and roast on low-medium flame until it turns aromatic and slightly golden.", "Boil water separately and add sugar to it, stirring until dissolved.", "Add the hot sugar water to the roasted semolina gradually, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.", "Add cardamom powder and saffron water or food color, mix well.", "Cook on low flame until the mixture thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.", "Add fried nuts and raisins, mix gently and turn off the heat.", "Cover and let it rest for a few minutes before serving."]

name: Brioche French Toast
instructions: ["In a bowl, whisk together milk and eggs until well combined.", "Add cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves to the mixture and stir well.", "Mix in sugar and a dash of vanilla extract.", "Dip brioche bread slices into the custard mixture for about 10 seconds on each side.", "Heat a skillet over medium heat and coat the bottom with clarified butter.", "Place dipped bread slices onto the skillet and cook for 7 and a half minutes on one side without touching.", "Flip the bread slices and cook for another 7 and a half minutes until golden brown and cooked through."]

name: Classic Pancakes
instructions: ["In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.", "In another bowl, whisk milk and egg together until combined.", "Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir gently until just combined.", "Add melted butter and mix lightly.", "Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease it.", "Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto the pan for each pancake.", "Cook until bubbles form on the surface and edges look set, about 2-3 minutes.", "Flip the pancake and cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.", "Repeat with remaining batter."]

name: Upgraded Oats Porridge
instructions: ["Chop fruits and nuts into bite-sized pieces.", "Prepare orange peel by zesting or finely chopping if fresh.", "Heat a pot over medium heat and add the oats along with salt, cinnamon, and cardamom.", "Toast the oats and spices, stirring frequently until fragrant.", "Gradually add oat milk while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.", "Cook slowly on low heat, adding more oat milk as needed, stirring until the porridge reaches desired creamy consistency.", "Stir in brown sugar and orange peel for added flavor.", "Remove from heat once cooked to preferred thickness."]

name: Vegetable Oats Upma
instructions: ["Finely chop the carrot, onion, and roughly chop the green chili.", "Peel and dice the potato into small pieces.", "Roast the oats in a dry pan until the color changes, then cool and set aside.", "Boil 2.5 cups of water and add green peas and chopped carrot; cook until vegetables are parboiled.", "Heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds and urad dal; fry until urad dal changes color.", "Add curry leaves, green chili, diced potato, and cashew nuts; sauté briefly.", "Add chopped onions and cook until softened.", "Add semolina and roast for a few minutes, then add the roasted oats.", "Pour in the boiling water with vegetables and stir continuously until water is absorbed and mixture thickens.", "Whisk wheat and curd together and add to the upma; mix well.", "Add salt, lemon juice, a dash of sugar (optional), freshly grated coconut (optional), and curry leaves; mix thoroughly and cook until desired consistency is reached.", "Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving."]

name: 16 Beetroot Recipes from Indian Cuisine
instructions: ["Just like any other vegetable, root veggies are also an important part of our lives. Out of the entire lot, beetroot or beets are one of those root vegetables that are not really popular with people. But we really can’t ignore the health benefits it has. For the same reason, I have shared my personal favorite collection of 16 Indian Beetroot Recipes here. These Beetroot Recipes include dry preparations (sabji), side dishes, snacks and sweets too.", "Beetroots are rich in iron, calcium and minerals and there are various ways you can include them in your meals. With this compilation, you will be able to dish-up some really simple and easy recipes with this gorgeous looking veggie, at the comfort of your home.", "Like I said, beetroot is a root vegetable having a vibrant crimson & deep red color. It also has a slightly sweet taste with an intense earthy flavor. Usually consumed both for its delicious taste and potential health benefits, its distinctive color comes from pigments called betalains, which also have antioxidant properties.  Beetroot can be eaten raw, cooked or pickled.", "It’s a rich source of essential nutrients, including dietary fiber, vitamins like folate and vitamin C, and minerals like potassium and iron. Additionally, beetroot contains natural compounds called nitrates, which have been associated with potential cardiovascular and exercise performance benefits.", "Beetroots and carrots often make an appearance in our menu. Apart from preparing the Beetroot Recipes listed below, I also add beetroots to pulao/pilaf or mixed vegetable dishes. name: Sabudana Khichdi
instructions: ["Soak sabudana in water for 3-4 hours until they bloom and absorb all water.", "Roast peanuts until golden and let them cool.", "Grind roasted peanuts into a fine powder.", "Heat oil in a pan and fry 2-3 tbsp of peanuts until crisp, then remove and set aside.", "Add cumin seeds to the hot oil and let them splutter.", "Add soaked sabudana to the pan along with salt and mix well.", "Add fried peanuts and lemon juice, mix thoroughly.", "Cover and cook on low heat for 2 minutes until sabudana becomes translucent.", "Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and mix well before serving."]

name: Poori Bhaji
instructions: ["Boil and crush the potatoes.", "Chop the tomatoes and green chillies.", "Mix turmeric, red chilli powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder in a small bowl.", "Heat oil in a pan and add jeera and khada masala.", "Add grated ginger and the mixed dry spices; sauté briefly.", "Add chopped tomatoes, heeng, salt, and green chillies; cook until tomatoes soften.", "Add hot water and crushed boiled potatoes; mix well and simmer.", "Finish by adding garam masala, kasuri methi, and chopped coriander leaves; stir and cook for a few minutes."]

name: Chole Bhature Breakfast Plate
instructions: ["Soak chickpeas overnight and boil them with cinnamon, bay leaves, cardamom, black pepper, turmeric, and salt until soft (about 5-6 whistles in a pressure cooker).", "Finely chop onions and tomatoes.", "Chop green chilies as per taste.", "Chop fresh coriander leaves.", "Heat oil in a wok and add cumin seeds.", "Add finely chopped onions and green chilies, sauté until onions turn golden.", "Add ginger garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.", "Add chopped tomatoes and a pinch of salt, cook until tomatoes soften.", "Add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, kitchen king masala, turmeric powder, and red chili powder; cook the spices well.", "Add the boiled chickpeas along with 1 cup water, mix well and simmer for a few minutes.", "Garnish with chopped fresh coriander leaves and remove from heat."]

name: Egg Fried Rice Breakfast
instructions: ["Beat the eggs in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.", "Prepare cooked rice, preferably cold or leftover rice for best texture.", "Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.", "Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until just cooked.", "Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir well to combine with the eggs.", "Season with salt, pepper, and soy sauce if using.", "Stir-fry for a few minutes until the rice is heated through and slightly crispy."]

name: Banana Smoothie Bowl
instructions: ["Peel and slice the ripe banana.", "Measure out the plant-based milk and oats.", "Prepare any desired toppings by chopping fruits or nuts."]

name: Vegetable Poha Cutlets
instructions: ["Rinse poha in water and drain well, keep aside to soften.", "Boil and mash the potatoes.", "Finely chop mixed vegetables, green chili, ginger, and coriander leaves.", "Prepare all spices and keep ready.", "Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves, sauté for a minute.", "Add chopped green chili and ginger, sauté briefly.", "Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender.", "Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt; mix well.", "Add softened poha and mashed potatoes, mix everything thoroughly.", "Turn off heat, add chopped coriander leaves and mix.", "Shape the mixture into small cutlets, coat with bread crumbs.", "Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the cutlets until golden and crispy on both sides."]

name: Bread Pakora
instructions: ["Chop green chili finely.", "Prepare the batter by mixing gram flour with water to a smooth consistency.", "Add chopped green chili, red chili powder, turmeric, carom seeds, and salt to the batter.", "Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.", "Dip each bread slice into the gram flour batter, coating both sides evenly.", "Carefully drop the coated bread slices into hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.", "Remove and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil."]

name: Stuffed Cheese Garlic Bread
instructions: ["Grate the garlic finely.", "Mix butter, grated garlic, salt, chilli flakes, oregano, and coriander together to form a flavored butter spread.", "Slice the bread if not pre-sliced.", "Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly on each slice of bread.", "Top each slice with a generous amount of grated cheese.", "Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted and golden."]

name: Sprouts Salad Bowl
instructions: ["Sprout the chana and moong dal until tender and ready to eat.", "Wash and peel the vegetables as needed.", "Chop cucumber, tomato, radish, carrot, and chakandar into small pieces."]

name: High-Protein Chocolate Peanut Butter Breakfast Parfait
instructions: ["Slice the fresh strawberries.", "Mix peanut butter, cocoa powder, and honey together to create the chocolate peanut butter layer.", "Prepare homemade granola if not store-bought."]

name: Blue Raspberry Smoothie Bowl
instructions: ["Gather all ingredients and wash the berries.", "Peel the banana and slice it for easier blending."]

name: Mango Smoothie Bowl
instructions: ["Peel and chop the ripe mango into small pieces.", "Gather all toppings such as granola and chia seeds."]

name: Besan Chilla
instructions: ["Sift the besan to remove lumps.", "Chop green chili and coriander leaves finely.", "Grate fresh ginger.", "Mix besan with water to form a smooth batter of pouring consistency.", "Add chopped green chili, ginger, cumin seeds, salt, and coriander leaves to the batter and mix well.", "Heat a non-stick pan and grease it lightly with oil.", "Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it evenly like a pancake.", "Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift and the bottom turns golden brown.", "Flip the chilla and cook the other side until golden and cooked through.", "Repeat with remaining batter."]

name: Moong Dal Chilla
instructions: ["Soak moong dal for a few hours or overnight until soft.", "Grind soaked moong dal with cumin seeds, salt, turmeric, black pepper powder, cumin powder, chopped onion, and garlic into a smooth batter.", "Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladle of batter to form a round chilla.", "Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift and the bottom is golden brown.", "Flip and cook the other side until golden and cooked through.", "Serve hot with green chutney and paneer."]

name: Rava Idli
instructions: ["Dry roast rava lightly until aromatic and let it cool.", "Chop green chili and grate ginger.", "Prepare tempering by heating oil and adding mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chili, and ginger.", "Mix yogurt with water to make a batter and add roasted rava, salt, and tempering.", "Let the batter rest for 10 minutes to soften.", "Add baking soda just before steaming and mix gently.", "Pour batter into greased idli molds and steam for 12-15 minutes until cooked through."]

name: Instant Set Dosa
instructions: ["Soak poha for some time before use.", "Add semolina, yogurt, soaked poha, and some water to a blender jar and blend to make a smooth batter.", "In a pan, sauté peanuts and roasted chana dal until well roasted.", "Transfer sautéed peanuts and chana dal to the blender jar along with fresh coconut, ginger, and green chili; blend and add this mixture to the dosa batter.", "Add baking soda to the batter and mix well.", "Heat a pan on high flame.", "Pour a ladle of batter onto the pan and cook on high flame initially.", "Reduce the flame to low-medium and cook the dosa on one side until the batter dries up and the bottom turns golden brown.", "Add butter or ghee on top of the dosa while cooking.", "Remove the dosa once cooked and serve hot with coconut chutney."]

name: Neer Dosa
instructions: ["Add 2 cups of water, 1 tsp salt, 2 tsp sugar, and 1½ cups of coconut milk into a blender jar.", "Add 2 cups of rice flour and 1 tsp ground coconut to the blender.", "Grind the mixture well for about 1 minute to form a smooth batter.", "Transfer the batter into a mixing bowl and add 2 more cups of water to adjust the consistency, mixing well to make a smooth, thin batter.", "Heat a non-stick pan or dosa pan on medium to high flame.", "If using a non-stick pan, no oil is needed; otherwise, lightly grease the pan.", "Pour a small amount of batter onto the hot pan and spread it thinly to form a small dosa.", "Cook the dosa for about 1.5 minutes until the edges start to lift from the pan; do not wait for golden color.", "Carefully remove the dosa from the pan and repeat with the remaining batter."]

name: Andhra Special Pesarattu
instructions: ["Soak whole green gram (moong dal) in water for 4-6 hours or overnight.", "Drain the soaked dal and grind it with green chilies and ginger to a smooth batter, adding water as needed.", "Mix rice flour and salt into the batter and adjust consistency to a pouring batter.", "Heat a non-stick or cast iron pan on medium heat.", "Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it thinly in a circular motion to form a crepe.", "Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook until the bottom turns golden brown and crisp.", "Flip and cook the other side briefly if desired, then remove from pan.", "Serve hot with chutney or upma."]

name: Onion Uttapam
instructions: ["Finely chop the onion, green chili, and curry leaves.", "Ensure the dosa/uttapam batter is well fermented and at room temperature.", "Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and grease it lightly with oil.", "Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it slightly thick.", "Sprinkle chopped onions, green chili, and curry leaves evenly over the batter.", "Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook on medium heat until the bottom turns golden brown.", "Flip the uttapam carefully and cook the other side for 1-2 minutes.", "Serve hot with chutney or sambar."]

name: Uttapam - Mixed Veg
instructions: ["Chop onions, tomatoes, green chili, and coriander leaves finely.", "Grate the carrot.", "Mix all the chopped vegetables in a bowl.", "Heat a non-stick pan and pour a ladle of fermented batter to form a thick pancake.", "Sprinkle the mixed vegetables evenly over the batter.", "Add salt to taste and drizzle some oil around the edges.", "Cook on medium heat until the bottom turns golden brown and the edges are crispy.", "Flip carefully and cook the other side for a minute.", "Serve hot with chutney or sambar."]

name: Eggless Banana Muffins
instructions: ["Peel and mash the ripe bananas in a large bowl using a fork until smooth.", "Add almond milk, sugar, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the mashed bananas and mix well with a fork.", "In a separate bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt.", "Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and mix with a fork until just combined.", "Optionally, fold in chopped walnuts and dark chocolate chips.", "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).", "Line a muffin tin with muffin liners.", "Scoop the batter evenly into the muffin tins, filling about 12 cups.", "Bake in the preheated oven for about 22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.", "Remove from oven and let the muffins cool for a few minutes before serving."]

name: Veggie Egg Muffins
instructions: ["Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).", "Chop the bell pepper, spinach, and onion into small pieces.", "Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk until well combined.", "Add the chopped vegetables, cheese, salt, and pepper to the eggs and mix well.", "Grease a muffin tin with olive oil or cooking spray.", "Pour the egg and vegetable mixture evenly into the muffin tin cups.", "Bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes or until the egg muffins are set and slightly golden on top.", "Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before removing from the tin."]

name: Breakfast Burrito - Veg
instructions: ["Crack eggs into a bowl and whisk until fluffy.", "Slice avocado.", "Mix chipotle hot sauce and mayonnaise to make a simple sauce.", "Warm the flour tortilla for about 10 seconds.", "Air-fry the tater tots until crispy.", "Cook eggs in a pan with a pinch of salt until set and fluffy.", "Assemble burrito by layering eggs, tater tots, sauce, and avocado on the tortilla.", "Fold in the sides and roll the burrito tightly.", "Toast the burrito seam side down until golden and warm."]

name: Simple Breakfast Burrito - Egg and Sausage
instructions: ["Crack eggs into a bowl and lightly beat them.", "Cook sausage links fully and slice or crumble them.", "Warm the tortilla slightly to make it pliable.", "Heat butter or oil in a pan over medium heat.", "Pour in beaten eggs and scramble gently until just set.", "Add cooked sausage to the eggs and mix gently.", "Remove from heat and sprinkle shredded cheese over the egg and sausage mixture.", "Place the mixture onto the warmed tortilla and roll it up tightly to form a burrito."]

name: Amazing Creamy Avocado Toast
instructions: ["Cut and mash the ripe avocado until creamy.", "Season the mashed avocado with salt and desired spices.", "Toast the bread slices until golden and crisp.", "Cook the egg to your preference (fried or poached).", "Spread the mashed avocado evenly over the toasted bread.", "Top with the cooked egg and sprinkle black sesame seeds on top."]

name: Tomato Cheese Toast
instructions: ["Slice the tomato into thin rounds.", "Shred the cheese if not pre-shredded.", "Butter the bread slices evenly on one side.", "Place the bread slices buttered side down on a pan or baking tray.", "Layer tomato slices on top of the bread.", "Sprinkle salt, black pepper, and oregano over the tomatoes.", "Top with shredded cheese evenly.", "Toast or bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 5 minutes or until the cheese melts and the bread is crispy."]

name: Crispy Fried Chicken Sandwich With Honey-Sriracha Sauce on a Brioche Bun
instructions: ["Flatten the chicken breast to an even thickness.", "Marinate the chicken breast in pickle juice for 24 hours in the refrigerator.", "Mix flour, paprika, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, and pepper to create the dredge.", "Crush corn flakes and set aside.", "Prepare the sauce by mixing chopped chives, mayonnaise, paprika, sriracha, and honey.", "Heat oil to 350 degrees Fahrenheit for frying.", "Dredge the marinated chicken breast first in the flour mixture, then dip in beaten egg, and finally coat with crushed corn flakes.", "Fry the chicken breast in hot oil until golden brown and crispy, about 10-15 minutes depending on thickness.", "Toast the brioche bun lightly if desired.", "Assemble the sandwich by spreading the honey-sriracha sauce on the bun and placing the fried chicken breast inside."]

name: Creamy Egg Salad Sandwich
instructions: ["Boil the eggs until hard boiled and let them cool.", "Peel the eggs and chop them finely.", "Mix the chopped eggs with mayonnaise, salt, and black pepper.", "No cooking required beyond boiling the eggs."]

name: Homemade Granola
instructions: ["Measure and combine oats, shredded coconut, chopped almonds, and chia seeds in a large bowl.", "In a saucepan, whisk together equal parts oil and sweetener with cinnamon and bring to a boil.", "Pour the hot mixture over the dry ingredients and fold until the mixture is wet but not soaked.", "Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet.", "Bake at 275°F (135°C) for 45 minutes until toasted and golden.", "Remove from oven, add raisins, toss to combine, and let cool before storing."]

name: Paneer Bhurji
instructions: ["Crumble the paneer into small pieces.", "Chop onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and coriander.", "Heat oil in a pan and sauté chopped onions until translucent.", "Add chopped green chilies and cook briefly.", "Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and oil separates.", "Add salt, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder; mix well.", "Add crumbled paneer and mix thoroughly with the masala.", "Add chopped coriander and mix well.", "Remove from heat and serve."]

name: Stuffed Capsicum Omelette
instructions: ["Cut the capsicum into bite-sized pieces.", "Beat the eggs with sugar, salt, and liquid sake.", "Heat oil in a pan and add the chopped capsicum pieces.", "Pour the beaten egg mixture over the capsicum and cook until the eggs are set."]

name: Masala Maggi Breakfast
instructions: ["Chop onions, tomatoes, green chili, and mixed vegetables finely.", "Keep all ingredients ready near the stove.", "Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions and green chili until translucent.", "Add tomatoes and cook until soft.", "Add mixed vegetables and cook for 2-3 minutes.", "Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt; mix well.", "Pour water and bring it to a boil.", "Add Maggi noodles and the masala tastemaker packet.", "Cook until noodles are soft and water is mostly absorbed, stirring occasionally.", "Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot."]

name: Thalipeeth
instructions: ["Soak wheat flour as required.", "Finely chop the large onion and green chili.", "Crush or finely chop garlic cloves.", "Mix ground wheat, besan, wheat flour, and soaked wheat flour in a large bowl.", "Add turmeric powder, sesame seeds, garlic, green chili, coriander powder, cumin powder, fenugreek seeds, and salt to the flour mixture.", "Add the finely chopped onion and mix everything well.", "Add water gradually and knead to form a thick but pliable dough.", "Heat a pan on medium heat.", "Take a ball of dough and place it on a cloth or plastic sheet greased with oil.", "Press the dough ball with a rolling pin to form a flat round shape with a hole in the center.", "Place the shaped dough on the hot pan.", "Pour some oil in the hole and around the edges.", "Cover and cook on medium heat for about 2 minutes.", "Flip the Thalipeeth and cook the other side for another 2 minutes until golden and cooked through.", "Remove from pan and serve hot."]

name: Travel Friendly Methi Thepla
instructions: ["Wash and chop fresh methi leaves.", "Make a paste of methi, ginger, and green chillies.", "Sauté the methi, ginger, and green chillies paste well to remove excess moisture.", "Mix the sautéed methi paste with wheat flour, spices, and oil to knead a soft dough.", "Roll the dough into thin flatbreads (theplas).", "Cook the theplas on a hot griddle until both sides are golden brown."]

name: Masala Cornflakes Mix
instructions: ["Cut one cashew into two pieces.", "Measure and prepare all ingredients including moong dal, cashews, peanuts, curry leaves, spices, cornflakes, raisins, and roasted mustard seeds.", "Heat 2 tbsp oil in a wok on low to medium flame.", "Add moong dal and roast until light brown and aromatic, then remove and set aside.", "In the same wok, roast cashews on low flame until light brown, then remove and set aside with peanuts.", "Remove excess oil from wok and add 2 tsp oil.", "Add curry leaves and roast until crisp, then turn off the flame.", "Add salt, dry mango powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and sugar powder to the curry leaves and mix well.", "Add cornflakes and mix gently on low flame to keep them crisp.", "Add raisins, roasted cashews, peanuts, and roasted mustard seeds, then mix all ingredients well on low flame.", "Turn off the flame and let the mixture cool completely before storing."]

name: Vegetable Sevai Upma
instructions: ["Chop all the vegetables into small pieces.", "Chop green chilies and ginger finely.", "Measure and keep vermicelli ready.", "Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.", "Add curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and ginger; sauté for a minute.", "Add chopped vegetables and sauté for 2-3 minutes.", "Add water and salt; bring it to a boil.", "Add vermicelli to the boiling water and cook until the water is absorbed and vermicelli is soft.", "Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes on low heat.", "Turn off the heat and let it rest covered for a couple of minutes before serving."]

name: Idiyappam with Hotel Style Vegetable Kurma
instructions: ["Wash and chop the mixed vegetables into small pieces.", "Slice the onion and slit the green chilies.", "Grate the ginger and fresh coconut.", "Measure and prepare all spices and ingredients for the kurma.", "Boil water with salt for making the idiyappam dough.", "Prepare the idiyappam dough by mixing rice flour with boiling salted water and knead into a soft dough.", "Fill the idiyappam press with the dough and press the noodles onto idli plates or steaming trays.", "Steam the idiyappam for 8-10 minutes until cooked.", "Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, cinnamon, cloves, and cardamom and sauté until aromatic.", "Add sliced onions, green chilies, and ginger; sauté until onions turn translucent.", "Add chopped vegetables, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt; cook for a few minutes.", "Grind grated coconut with some water to make a smooth paste and add it to the vegetables.", "Add water and cook the kurma covered until vegetables are tender.", "Add garam masala and chopped coriander leaves; cook for another 2 minutes and turn off the heat.", "Serve hot idiyappam with the vegetable kurma."]

name: Appam with Vegetable Stew
instructions: ["Soak rice and cooked rice separately for a few hours.", "Grind soaked rice and cooked rice into a smooth batter, add yeast and sugar, and ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight.", "Chop vegetables finely.", "Prepare spices by crushing cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves.", "Heat oil in a pan, add cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, ginger, green chili, and curry leaves and sauté.", "Add chopped vegetables and cook until tender.", "Pour in coconut milk and simmer gently, seasoning with salt.", "Heat a non-stick pan, pour fermented batter in a circular motion to form appams, cover and cook until edges are crisp and center is soft.", "Serve hot appams with vegetable stew."]

name: Instant Ragi Dosa
instructions: ["Mix ragi flour and rice flour in a bowl.", "Add salt to taste.", "Gradually add water and whisk to form a smooth batter of pouring consistency.", "Heat a non-stick pan or griddle on medium heat.", "Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it thinly in a circular motion.", "Drizzle some oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns crisp and edges lift.", "Flip if desired and cook the other side for a few seconds.", "Remove and serve hot with chutney or sambar."]

name: Ragi Idli
instructions: ["Soak idli rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds together for 4-6 hours.", "Grind the soaked ingredients into a smooth batter using water as needed.", "Mix ragi flour into the batter and add salt.", "Allow the batter to ferment overnight or for 8-12 hours until it rises.", "Grease idli molds and pour the fermented batter into them.", "Steam the idlis in an idli steamer or pressure cooker without the weight for 12-15 minutes.", "Check doneness by inserting a toothpick; it should come out clean.", "Remove idlis from molds and serve hot."]

name: Millet Upma
instructions: ["Soak 1/2 cup foxtail millet in enough water for 15 minutes.", "Chop onion, green chillies, ginger, carrot, beans, and tomato.", "Gather curry leaves and measure dals and spices.", "Heat 2 tsp ghee in a wide saucepan.", "Add 1 tsp chana dal, 1 tsp urad dal, 1/2 tsp mustard seeds, and 1/2 tsp cumin seeds for tempering.", "Once mustard seeds splatter, add chopped onion, green chillies, ginger, and curry leaves; sauté until onions turn transparent.", "Add chopped carrot, beans, and green peas; sauté for 2 minutes.", "Add chopped tomato, 1 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp turmeric powder; sauté for 5 minutes.", "Add 1 1/2 cups water, cover, and cook vegetables for 5 minutes.", "Drain soaked millet and add to the pan; cover and cook on low flame for 15 minutes until millet is cooked and water is absorbed."]

name: Korra Pongal
instructions: ["Wash the pesarapam (millet) thoroughly in water.", "Soak rice overnight or for at least 2-3 hours for best results.", "Chop green chillies and ginger into small pieces.", "Cook the pesarapam on low flame for about 15 minutes until it gets a nice color.", "Add the cooked pesarapam to water in a pressure cooker along with soaked rice and salt.", "Pressure cook for 4 to 5 whistles on medium flame.", "In a pan, heat ghee and add cumin seeds, black pepper, green chillies, ginger, and curry leaves; fry for 2 minutes.", "Add this tempering to the cooked millet and rice mixture and mix well.", "Allow the Pongal to thicken slightly before serving."]

name: Ven Pongal
instructions: ["Wash the rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.", "Chop or slit the green chilies and finely chop or grate the ginger.", "Prepare the curry leaves by washing them well.", "Boil 4 cups of water in a pot on medium flame.", "Add soaked rice and salt to the boiling water and cook until the rice is soft and cooked through.", "In a separate pan, heat ghee on low flame.", "Add cumin seeds, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves, black peppercorns, and asafoetida to the ghee and sauté until fragrant.", "Add the cooked rice to the pan with the tempered spices and mix well.", "Simmer the mixture on low flame for 15 minutes to blend the flavors.", "Turn off the stove and serve hot."]

name: Sweet Pongal
instructions: ["Wash and soak the rice and moong dal together for 15 minutes.", "Grate or chop jaggery if using a block.", "Roast moong dal in ghee until aromatic and slightly golden.", "Add soaked rice and water to the pot and cook until soft and mushy.", "Melt jaggery in a separate pan with a little water and strain to remove impurities.", "Add the jaggery syrup to the cooked rice and dal mixture and cook on low heat until combined and thickened.", "Add cardamom powder, fried cashews, and raisins in ghee, and mix into the pongal.", "Cook for a few more minutes until the pongal reaches a creamy consistency."]

name: Dal Khichdi
instructions: ["Wash 1 cup rice and 1 cup moong dal together and keep aside.", "Chop onions, tomatoes, potatoes, green chillies, and prepare ginger and garlic (either chopped or paste).", "Measure out all spices and other ingredients.", "Heat 4 tsp oil in a pressure cooker.", "Add 1 1/4 tsp asafoetida and 1 tsp cumin seeds; let them splutter.", "Add ginger, garlic, and curry leaves; sauté until fragrant.", "Add chopped onions and fry on medium flame for 3-4 minutes until onions change color.", "Add chopped tomatoes and green chillies; cook until tomatoes soften.", "Add chopped potatoes and green peas; mix well.", "Add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, and 1 tsp garam masala powder; mix well.", "Add the washed rice and dal mixture; fry for 30 seconds on medium flame.", "Add 6 cups water and salt to taste; stir well.", "Close the pressure cooker lid and cook on medium flame for 4 whistles.", "Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally before opening the lid.", "Optionally, prepare tempering by heating 1 tbsp ghee, adding 4 garlic cloves and curry leaves, cooking until garlic turns brown, then pour over the khichdi.", "Garnish with chopped coriander leaves if desired and mix lightly."]

name: Masala Sabudana Vada
instructions: ["Rinse sabudana thoroughly and soak in water for 4-5 hours or overnight until soft.", "Drain excess water from soaked sabudana and keep aside.", "Roast peanuts until golden and grind coarsely.", "Boil and peel potatoes, then mash them well.", "Chop green chilies and coriander leaves finely.", "In a mixing bowl, combine soaked sabudana, mashed potatoes, ground peanuts, green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander leaves, and salt.", "Mix all ingredients well to form a dough-like mixture.", "Heat oil in a deep frying pan on medium heat.", "Shape the mixture into small round flat vadas.", "Deep fry the vadas in hot oil until they turn golden brown and crispy.", "Remove and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil."]

name: Egg Cheese Toast
instructions: ["Crack the egg into a bowl and whisk lightly with salt and pepper.", "Heat butter in a pan over medium heat.", "Pour the whisked egg into the pan and cook until slightly set.", "Place the cheese slice on top of the egg and let it melt.", "Toast the bread until golden and crispy.", "Assemble the sandwich by placing the egg and melted cheese on the toasted bread."]

name: Cheesy Scrambled Eggs
instructions: ["Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk thoroughly with a fork until well combined.", "Preheat a skillet over medium-high heat and add butter.", "Pour the whisked eggs into the skillet and keep stirring continuously.", "Add the American cheese slices early in the cooking process and continue stirring.", "When the eggs are almost cooked, turn off the heat and season with salt.", "Plate the scrambled eggs and serve immediately."]

Keep them immersed in water until required.", "Chop a cauliflower head, to make 2 cups (180 grams) florets, chopped to 1½ inch. name: Baingan Bharta Recipe (Eggplant Bharta)
instructions: ["▢ 500 grams (1.1 lbs.) eggplants (1 large baingan)", "▢ 4 medium garlic cloves (may omit if you don't want)", "▢ 1 to 2 green chilies (slit, adjust to taste, may omit if you don't prefer)", "▢ 1 teaspoon oil (mustard oil or any other)", "▢ 1½ tablespoons oil (mustard oil or any other)", "▢ ½ cup (130 grams) onions (chopped)", "▢ ¾ cup (200 grams) tomato (deseeded & chopped)", "▢ 3 large garlic cloves (fine chopped)", "▢ ½ to ¾ inch ginger (fine chopped)", "▢ ½ teaspoon Kashmiri red chilli powder (adjust to taste)", "▢ ¼ to ½ teaspoon garam masala (start with lower amount, read notes)", "▢ ¾ teaspoon salt (adjust to taste)", "▢ 2 tablespoon coriander leaves (fine chopped)", "▢ Rinse eggplants well under running water and wipe dry with a kitchen tissue. Make 4 slits on the brinjal. If you want to use the garlic & chili – push the garlic cloves deep inside 2 slits. Also push the slit green chilies in the other 2 slits. Brush them with oil.", "▢ On Direct Fire : With the help of a tong, place it on direct fire. You can do it either on the red hot coal or stovetop. Keep turning it to all the other sides and grill until it is done completely roasted & cooked through. It takes about 12 to 14 mins.", "▢ To grill in oven : Line a metal tray with foil. Cut each eggplant to 2 parts and place them on the tray with the skin side on top. You can also place the tomatoes in the same tray. instructions: ["I haven’t used yogurt or milk in this recipe. But you can always use one of them. Or you can also substitute cream with coconut cream and paneer with tofu.", "A lot of restaurants use canned pineapple for garnish. name: Veg Biryani
instructions: ["Boil water with black pepper, cinnamon, bay leaf, and ghee.", "Soak the rice in the boiling water and cook until done.", "Mix curd with biryani masala, garam masala, coriander powder, Kashmiri red chilli powder, and turmeric powder.", "Chop onions, green chillies, tomatoes, potatoes, coriander, and mint leaves.", "Cut potatoes into medium-sized pieces.", "Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions, cook until soft.", "Add green chillies and garlic paste, cook briefly.", "Add chopped tomatoes and salt, increase flame and cook until tomatoes are soft.", "Add biryani masala and cook until oil separates.", "Add potatoes and cook well.", "Add the cooked biryani rice, chopped coriander, and mint leaves, mix gently.", "Cover and cook on medium flame for 5 minutes to let flavors combine and rice finish cooking.", "Turn off the stove and serve hot."]

name: Chicken Biryani
instructions: ["Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes.", "Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, salt, and lemon juice for at least 30 minutes.", "Slice onions thinly and chop tomatoes, coriander, and mint leaves.", "Heat oil or ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot and fry whole spices until aromatic.", "Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.", "Add marinated chicken and cook until chicken is tender and oil separates.", "Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and cook until tomatoes soften.", "Parboil the soaked rice with salt and whole spices until 70% cooked.", "Layer the chicken curry and parboiled rice in the pot, sprinkle garam masala, coriander, and mint leaves.", "Cover tightly and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-25 minutes to allow flavors to meld.", "Turn off heat and let it rest for 10 minutes before serving."]

Soak them in 3 ½ to 4 cups of water overnight or for at least 8 hours.", "▢ Drain the water and rinse them well. Pour water and pressure cook for 5 to 6 whistles on a stovetop cooker. You may also cook in an instant pot for 18 minutes on a high pressure. Let the pressure drop naturally.", "▢ Make sure your chickpeas are soft and tender. Squeeze a chickpea to test, it should get mashed fully. If not cook them for a little longer.", "▢ Heat a large pot and pour oil. When the oil turns slightly hot, add the whole spices – cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms and bay leaf.", "▢ When they begin to sizzle add the onions and green chili. Saute until they turn light golden.", "▢ Add ginger garlic paste and saute for a minute without burning.", "▢ Add tomatoes and salt. Let cook until mushy, pulpy and thick.", "▢ Stir in red chilli powder, turmeric, garam masala, coriander powder and cumin powder. Saute until the masala begins to smell good, for about 3 to 4 mins.", "▢ Optional – If you want a smooth curry, cool this, discard the bay leaf, green chili and cinnamon. Blend in a blender to a smooth or coarse paste to suit your liking. I prefer to blend in 2 tbsps cooked chana along with the onion tomato masala. Add that puree back to the pan.", "▢ Add the chana along with the chana stock or water (1¼ cups). Pour another ¾ to 1 cup water. If you don't puree the onion tomato masala, you will require lesser water. If using canned chickpeas, drain and rinse them before adding with 1¾ cups water.", "▢ Mix well. name: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: ["Dice paneer into cubes.", "Soak cashews in warm water for 15 minutes.", "Chop onions, green chillies, and tomatoes.", "Blend soaked cashews with tomatoes to make a smooth puree.", "Heat butter in a pan, add paneer cubes with salt, turmeric, and red chilli powder; fry until golden brown on all sides and set aside.", "In the same pan, add jeera, whole red chillies, green chillies, and chopped onions; sauté until onions turn translucent.", "Add ginger-garlic paste and basic masalas; fry until raw smell disappears.", "Add the tomato-cashew puree and cook until the oil separates.", "Add fried paneer cubes to the gravy and simmer for a few minutes.", "Garnish with coriander leaves and kasoori methi before serving."]

name: Dal Tadka
instructions: ["Wash and soak the mixed dal if desired.", "Chop onions, tomatoes, green chilli, fresh ginger, and coriander leaves.", "Add 1 liter water to 300 grams mixed dal along with turmeric and red chilli powder in a pressure cooker.", "Cook the dal for 3 whistles until soft.", "Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.", "Add ginger garlic paste and green chilli; sauté briefly.", "Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown.", "Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.", "Add salt after tomatoes are cooked.", "Add cooked dal to the pan; if thick, add some water and mix well.", "Add garam masala, kasturi methi, and chopped coriander leaves; mix well.", "In a separate small pan, heat ghee for tempering.", "Add dry red chillies, finely chopped ginger, and Kashmiri chilli powder; sauté briefly.", "Pour the tempering over the dal and mix well.", "Simmer for a few minutes to blend flavors and serve hot."]

name: Rajma Chawal
instructions: ["Soak rajma (red kidney beans) overnight or for at least 6-8 hours.", "Chop onions finely.", "Prepare ginger, garlic, and green chili paste.", "Heat mustard oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, bay leaves, dried red chillies, and a pinch of asafoetida; sauté well.", "Add chopped onions and cook for 8-10 minutes until golden brown.", "Add ginger, garlic, green chili paste, and 2 tbsp asafoetida; mix well.", "Add tomato puree and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally.", "Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, rajma masala, garam masala, and salt; mix well.", "Add soaked rajma and enough water to cover; stir in kasuri methi powder.", "Cover and cook on low heat for 5-6 minutes or until rajma is tender and gravy thickens.", "Do not overcook or let it dry out; adjust consistency as needed."]

name: Chole Bhature
instructions: ["Wash the Kabuli chana twice and soak it in alkaline water with 1.5 tsp sweet soda for 6 hours.", "Soak 1 cup semolina in 1 cup water for 5 minutes until soft, then drain excess water.", "Make a dough by mixing semolina, wheat flour dough, 2 tsp salt, 2 tsp sugar, 1.5 tsp sweet soda, and 2 tsp curd; knead well for 7 minutes until smooth and soft.", "Add 1 tbsp oil to the dough and knead for another 3-4 minutes, then coat the dough with oil, cover with a cloth, and let it rest for 6 hours.", "Grind 2 medium onions with 1 tsp anardana into a paste without adding water.", "Grind 2 tomatoes separately and strain the juice to remove excess water.", "Peel and chop the potato.", "Prepare dry spices: cardamom, black pepper, cloves, and tea leaves.", "Heat 2 tsp oil in a pressure cooker and add cardamom, black pepper, cloves; fry briefly until aromatic.", "Add the onion and anardana paste, salt, and fry until the mixture is sticky and cooked.", "Add 1-2 tsp ginger garlic paste and fry for a minute.", "Add the strained tomato juice and cook on medium-high flame until raw smell disappears and oil separates.", "Add red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and fry the masala for 2 minutes until oil shines.", "Add 1.5 tsp sweet soda to the masala and mix well.", "Add soaked chickpeas, chopped potato, dry amla pieces, tea leaves, and 1.5 cups water; mix and pressure cook for 5-6 whistles on high flame.", "Lower the flame and simmer for 10 minutes, then turn off the gas and allow pressure to release naturally.", "Mash the potatoes slightly in the cooked chole and bring the mixture to a boil again.", "Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a pan, add 1.5 tbsp ajwain and ginger, cook for 15-20 seconds, then add this tempering to the chole.", "Divide the rested dough into portions, roll each into a puri shape without drying the dough.", "Heat oil for deep frying; fry each rolled bhature in hot oil until it puffs up fully and turns golden brown on both sides.", "Serve hot bhature with the prepared chole."]

name: Jeera Rice with Dal Fry
instructions: ["Wash and soak the lentils for 10-15 minutes.", "Finely chop the onion and tomatoes.", "Wash and soak basmati rice for 15 minutes.", "Chop green chilies as needed.", "Cook the soaked lentils with double the amount of water, salt, and turmeric until soft and boiling.", "In a wok, heat 2 tbsp ghee and add 1.5 tbsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp garlic paste, and 2-3 green chilies; sauté briefly.", "Add finely chopped onion, red chili powder, turmeric powder, chopped tomatoes, and salt; cook until tomatoes are soft.", "Add the cooked lentils to the tomato mixture and mix well; bring to a boil and then turn off the heat.", "In a separate pan, heat 1 tbsp ghee, add cumin seeds, 2 green chilies, finely chopped garlic, and a pinch of Kashmiri red chili powder; cook slightly and add curry leaves if available.", "Pour this tempering into the dal and mix well.", "Cook basmati rice with cumin seeds (jeera) and water until fluffy.", "Serve the dal fry hot with jeera rice."]

name: Lemon Rice
instructions: ["Cook rice and let it cool to room temperature.", "Chop green chilies and gather curry leaves.", "Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds; let them splutter.", "Add peanuts and fry until golden brown.", "Add chopped green chilies and curry leaves; sauté briefly.", "Add turmeric powder and salt; mix well.", "Add the cooked rice and mix gently to combine all ingredients.", "Turn off the heat and add lemon juice; mix well."]

name: Thecha Curd Rice
instructions: ["Cook rice and let it cool to room temperature.", "Chop green chili, garlic, and coriander leaves.", "Prepare thecha by dry roasting mustard seeds, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, and dry red chilies until aromatic.", "Grind the roasted spices with garlic, green chili, and peanuts to make a coarse chutney.", "Heat oil in a pan and temper mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves, and green chili.", "Mix the tempered spices and thecha chutney into the cooked rice.", "Add curd to the rice mixture and mix well to achieve a creamy consistency.", "Garnish with chopped coriander and serve chilled or at room temperature."]

name: Veg Pulao
instructions: ["Wash and soak the rice for 10-15 minutes.", "Chop the potato and green chili.", "Chop coriander leaves.", "Heat ghee in a pressure cooker and add ginger garlic paste, green chili, and spices (coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric, pav bhaji masala, garam masala).", "Add chopped potato and green peas, sauté for a minute.", "Add soaked rice and salt, mix gently with light hands.", "Add 2 cups of water and chopped coriander leaves.", "Squeeze lemon wedge over the mixture and stir lightly.", "Close the lid and cook on medium heat until 2 whistles.", "Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally.", "Open the lid, fluff the rice gently, and serve."]

name: Mushroom Masala
instructions: ["Clean and slice the mushrooms.", "Finely chop the onion and green chili.", "Puree the tomatoes.", "Gather and measure all spices.", "Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds until they splutter.", "Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.", "Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili; cook until raw smell disappears.", "Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.", "Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.", "Add sliced mushrooms and cook covered for 10-12 minutes until mushrooms are tender.", "Add garam masala and mix well.", "Stir in fresh cream and cook for another 2 minutes.", "Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot."]

name: Kadai Paneer
instructions: ["Roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, black pepper, and coriander again until fragrant and grind to a powder.", "Slice onions and capsicum into strips.", "Chop coriander leaves.", "Prepare tomato puree if not ready.", "Heat oil in a pan and fry paneer cubes until golden. Remove and set aside.", "In the same pan, add sliced onions and capsicum, stir fry briefly and remove.", "Add cumin seeds and sliced onions, fry until onions are translucent.", "Add ginger garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.", "Add tomato puree and cook for 5 minutes.", "Add salt, red chilli powder, turmeric powder, and the prepared masala powder, cook for 3 minutes.", "Add fresh cream and mix well.", "Add fried onions, capsicum, and paneer, mix and cook for 3 minutes.", "Add water, mix well, and cook for 5 minutes.", "Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and cashew nuts before serving."]

name: Palak Paneer
instructions: ["Wash the spinach 2-3 times thoroughly.", "Boil water with 1 tsp sugar and blanch the spinach in it for 2 minutes.", "Transfer the blanched spinach to cold water to retain green color.", "Add spinach, 2 green chilies, and coriander leaves to a blender and grind to a smooth puree without adding extra water.", "Chop onions finely.", "Grind tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and cashews together to make a smooth paste.", "Slice garlic cloves thinly for tadka.", "Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and bay leaves.", "Add chopped onions and fry on high flame for 3-4 minutes until golden.", "Add the tomato-ginger-garlic-cashew paste and cook well.", "Add salt, red chili powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and 1 tsp water; mix and cook covered on low flame for 3-4 minutes until oil separates.", "Add roasted crushed fenugreek leaves and garam masala; mix well.", "Add spinach puree and 1.5 cups water (adjust as per serving preference), cover and cook on low flame for 7-8 minutes.", "Add malai (fresh cream) and butter; mix well to make the gravy creamy.", "Add paneer cubes (either fried or directly) and cook covered for 3-4 minutes on low flame.", "In a small pan, heat 2 tsp desi ghee, add sliced garlic and fry on low flame until golden brown.", "Add dry red chillies and 1 tsp red chili powder; fry briefly and pour this tadka over the cooked palak paneer.", "Mix gently and serve hot with paratha, naan, or rice."]

name: Aloo Gobi

name: Restaurant Style Mix Veg Curry

name: Rohu Fish Curry
instructions: ["Clean and cut the rohu fish into pieces.", "Chop onions and tomatoes finely.", "Prepare ginger and garlic paste.", "Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds and cumin seeds until they splutter.", "Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.", "Add ginger and garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.", "Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft and oil separates.", "Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt; mix well.", "Add fish pieces and gently coat them with the masala.", "Pour water and cover the pan; cook on medium heat until fish is cooked through and the gravy thickens.", "Garnish and serve hot."]

name: Egg Curry (Dhaba Style)

name: Chicken Maharani Curry
